hero.title: Frontstart.ru — educational platform for frontend developers

items.value: Frontend: React 19, TypeScript, Zustand, React Router, Tailwind CSS, PostCSS. Backend: Node.js, Fastify, PM2, VPS, Cron, Google Gemini AI, Telegram Bot API
items.label: stack

workDone.label: what I did
workDone.value: Designed and developed educational platform from scratch: knowledge base with ~1000 materials in 11 categories, search and filtering system, learning progress, AI assistant on Gemini, Telegram channel integration, publication automation via Cron. Frontend on React 19 + TypeScript, Backend on Node.js + Fastify, deployment on VPS with PM2.

sections.text: Frontstart.ru is an educational platform for frontend developers who want to refresh knowledge and learn something new in their specialization. Platform is a site with article database, placed in 11 categories: two humanities (computer science and IT hiring) and nine technical (network, tools, layout, JavaScript, TypeScript, architecture, frameworks, optimization, security).

Materials in each category split by subsections, grouped, and divided by difficulty level: for junior, middle, and senior developers (basic, intermediate, advanced levels). Currently platform has about a thousand materials, making it one of largest Russian-language knowledge bases for frontend development.

Platform includes search and filtering system for materials by tags, sections, and specific words. Flexible search implemented: can enter needed word or select it in content part with double click — automatically opens search results of all materials matching query. This ensures convenient navigation and quick access to needed information.

Platform allows user to go through materials with explicit learning progress. For each category can read article and mark it as studied. Inside category displays percentage of study progress, so user sees their progress and can continue learning in different sections at convenient pace. Sessions saved in client device localStorage.

Important component of project is AI assistant based on Google Gemini Flash, which helps in deepening and understanding current topic. It can give task for reinforcement, help reveal topic deeper, answer questions, check knowledge. This is personal assistant-coach, trained to help within portal and requested topic. Notes functionality also implemented for marking during learning.

Project includes support in form of Telegram channel. Site has backend that several times a day automatically sends to Telegram channel materials from knowledge base with examples. All this happens automatically via Cron on VPS server.

Development took about three weeks. First mockup was formed and generated by Google Gemini. Later project moved under full management on local machine in Cursor editor with built-in AI assistants. This was document-oriented development and mostly wipe-coding. As result project was made quite quickly and quality. Thought-out adaptive design system for mobile devices and any screens.

blocks.text: As a frontend developer, I needed to structure my knowledge for more successful and effective technical interviews. Existing educational platforms didn't provide single place with learning progress, categorization system by difficulty level, and personal AI assistant for deepening knowledge. Needed a platform that combines all this in one place.

Create educational platform with article database for frontend developers:

- organize materials in 11 categories with subsections and difficulty levels
- implement search and filtering system by tags, sections, and words
- add learning progress system with localStorage saving
- integrate AI assistant for learning help
- create notes functionality for users
- automate publications to Telegram channel
- ensure adaptive design for all devices

blocks.subtitle: Content structure and categories
blocks.text: Organized knowledge base from ~1000 materials in 11 categories: two humanities (computer science, IT hiring) and nine technical (network, tools, layout, JavaScript, TypeScript, architecture, frameworks, optimization, security). Materials split by subsections, grouped, and divided by difficulty level: for junior (basic), middle (intermediate), and senior (advanced) developers. This allows users to choose materials by their level and gradually improve qualifications.

blocks.subtitle: Search and filtering system
blocks.text: Implemented flexible search and filtering system for materials by tags, sections, and specific words. Can enter needed word in search bar or select it in content part with double click — automatically opens search results of all materials matching query. This ensures convenient navigation and quick access to needed information without need to go through many pages.

blocks.subtitle: Learning progress and notes
blocks.text: Platform allows user to go through materials with explicit learning progress. For each category can read article and mark it as studied. Inside category displays percentage of study progress, so user sees their progress and can continue learning in different sections at convenient pace. Sessions saved in client device localStorage. Notes functionality also implemented so users can make marks during learning.

blocks.subtitle: AI assistant on Google Gemini
blocks.text: Integrated AI assistant based on Google Generative AI Gemini Flash. Assistant helps in deepening and understanding current topic: can give task for reinforcement, help reveal topic deeper, answer questions, check knowledge. This is personal assistant-coach, trained to help within portal and requested topic. Assistant works via API and processes user requests in real time.

blocks.subtitle: Telegram bot and automation
blocks.text: Implemented backend that several times a day automatically sends to [Telegram channel](https://t.me/frontstart_ru) materials from knowledge base with examples. Automation works via Cron on VPS server. Backend uses Telegram Bot API for content publishing. This ensures regular channel updates and audience attraction through useful content.

blocks.subtitle: Frontend architecture
blocks.text: Frontend built on React 19 with TypeScript for type safety. Use Zustand for state management, React Router for navigation, Tailwind CSS and PostCSS for styling. Component architecture split into components, core, features, hooks, and utility scripts. Secrets stored in ENV variables. Thought-out adaptive design system for mobile devices and any screens.

blocks.subtitle: Backend architecture
blocks.text: Backend works on Node.js using Fastify for API creation. Protection and security ensured via CORS (Fastify CORS). Server works on own virtual server (VPS). For process management uses PM2 — process manager for running and maintaining backend scripts in working state. Schedule for sending messages to Telegram works via Cron. AI assistant integrated via Google Generative AI Gemini Flash API.

blocks.subtitle: Development process
blocks.text: Development took about three weeks. First mockup was formed and generated by Google Gemini. Later project moved under full management on local machine in Cursor editor with built-in AI assistants. This was document-oriented development and mostly wipe-coding. Under my careful guidance flexible and stable architecture was developed where making changes and code generation became effective and fast.

Created fully functional educational platform Frontstart.ru with knowledge base of ~1000 materials in 11 categories. All stated functions implemented: search and filtering system, learning progress with localStorage saving, AI assistant on Gemini, notes functionality, automatic publication to Telegram channel. Platform has adaptive design for all devices and fully ready for use.

Project solves my personal task as frontend developer specialist for structuring knowledge for more successful technical interviews. Simultaneously project is my portfolio and open for other developers, hope it brings benefit to other specialists.

Platform available at [frontstart.ru](https://frontstart.ru), Telegram channel: [t.me/frontstart_ru](https://t.me/frontstart_ru)
